title: What part of speech is the word ''can't''? - Quora

response.answer_text: Can’t is a contraction — used w a verb —similar to cannot I can not go/ can’t go She can not marry him /can’t marry He can not read /can’t read He can’t be serious?! We cannot figure this out /can’t figure it out They cannot graduate yet / can’t graduate In speaking you might use it as an answer — “Can you come with us on Saturday?” “I can’t.”
This is basically modal auxiliary verb. can, could, may, might, shall, should, will, would all of this are modal auxiliary verb. So that’s why this is verb.
